nodes.value: To help debug your euchre program (specifically euchre_test01), we have provided an explanation for  each players decision making in each hand.. . Helpful Tips:. 1. If your player is playing or leading the wrong card, take a look at the play_card function, specifically how you compare cards and consider trump.. 2. If your player has the wrong cards in their hand, take a look at the shuffle function in pack.. 3. If your player is calling up trump when it they aren't suppose to (or vice versa), take a look at the card classification functions in Card.cpp (is_trump, is_face_or_ace, is_right_bower, is_left_bower).. 4. Make sure you ALWAYS account for the left bower. It is considered a trump suit not it's original suit. Ex: if hearts was trump, the J of Diamonds is considered a heart not a diamond.. . You can find the explanation in the publicEECS280 drive or by clicking this link.

P3 Overview. Slides. Recording. . Euchre Rules. Q: I’ve never played Euchre before, how do I learn the rules of the game?. . A1: Spec: EECS 280 Euchre Rules. . A2: Slides: Welcome to Euchre Afternoon. . A3: YouTube: How to Play EECS 280 Euchre with Simple Players. . Q: How come the left bower was played when the led suit is trump? Why didn’t the left bower follow suit?. . The left bower is always considered the trump suit! Let’s say trump is hearts. That means the left bower is the jack of diamonds. If the led suit is diamonds, playing the jack of diamonds DOES NOT follow suit because the left bower is considered the trump suit (aka hearts). If the led suit is hearts, playing the jack of diamonds DOES follow suit because the left bower is considered the trump suit (aka hearts).. Card.cpp. Pack.cpp. Q: Why won’t pack.in open in pack public tests when running on Xcode?. . Click on the name of your scheme in the toolbar at the top left, Edit Scheme > Options > Enable “Custom Working Directory” and press the little folder icon. Pick the folder that contains your code along with pack.in. This will ensure that the file is visible to your executable. This is usually not a problem, and we are investigating the issue.. Player.cpp. Q: Can I add helper functions while implementing the Player classes?. . You are allowed to use helper functions, but these helper functions should not change the interface of the class. So within your implementations of the class’s member functions, feel free to call helpers. But in your test files, you should not assume that these functions exist (because you should not alter the interface for the classes). This also applies in your euchre driver as well! e.g. If you add a helper function to the simple player class, you can use it within that class, but you can’t use it in the driver since it won’t be part of the Player interface!. . This is especially important because when we run your test cases against an intentionally buggy solution, that solution will not have your specially defined helper functions! So just use the interfaces of each class when you test them.. . Q: Do I need to worry about the human player doing (insert illegal move) during the game?. . No, in accordance with the spec you can assume that a human player will follow the rules of the game and will not attempt to cheat.. . Q: Why am I getting a compiler error for calling sort?. . Note that the sort function modifies the hand. You cannot modify member variables in a const function, so you’ll receive a compiler error you call sort in a const member function.. . You shouldn’t need to sort using card less. When you print the hand in order it should be sorted using the < operator. You could sort with card less when determining what action to take, but you should be able to find the min/max card in the hand without sorting. You could use a functor to sort using card less, but those are only covered later in the course. Generally: if you need to use sort, just the default one will be fine.. . Q: I keep getting an error: “error: creating array of ‘Player’, which is an abstract class type" or error: creating vector of ‘Player’, which is an abstract class type” or “Allocating an object of abstract class type Player” or “Allocating an object of abstract class to type Simple”…what does it mean?. . Player is an abstract class because it has at least one pure virtual function (see https://eecs280staff.github.io/notes/10_Polymorphism.html#abstract-classes-and-interfaces for a detailed description). You cannot create an object of an abstract class so you may not create a Player object. If you haven’t implemented all the player class functions in simple and human player, you also cannot create a simple or human player object because the simple and human classes inherit the pure virtual function.. . If you are getting the error on a line where you create a Simple or Human player, go back and ensure you coded each of the required functions. If you are getting the error on a line where you create a Player, think of another way to code the function. There are no instances where you should be creating a Player because none of it;s functions are implemented. Note: you are able to create a Player* that points to either a Simple or Human player. This is because you are not actually creating a Player object, you are actually creating a Simple or Human player object.. euchre.cpp. Q: Why am I passing euchre public test, but failing euchre public test with solution card, pack, and player?. . This means that when your euchre.cpp is run with the instructor solution implementations of card, pack, and player you produce incorrect output. This likely means that you’re making an incorrect assumption about what functionality should go in card/pack/player versus in the game of euchre. For example, make sure that you’re not printing output in player.cpp that should be printed in euchre.cpp..

Hello everyone!. . Please get hyped for our world famous once-in-a-semester EECS 280 euchre social! This Saturday, February 4th, the EECS 280 staff will be hosting a student get-together where you and other students will have a chance to learn and play Euchre. Not only will you have a chance to enjoy a fun card game with other students, but this event is also very helpful for the logic behind coding project 3 - the Euchre project.. . From 12:00 - 12:15 pm EST in Mason Hall 1427, we will be giving a basic rundown of how to play Euchre before breaking off to play in smaller groups until 2pm. Cards will be provided, but do feel free to bring your own if you want.. . The link to the slides on how to play are located [here](https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/129P1PUHSY4EA9N4Ag0CJlPc3tEowegAwLJ6E03vKhqw/edit?usp=sharing), but we will go over these again on Saturday. We look forward to seeing you!. . \-EECS 280 Staff

In the context of euchre.cpp, this function is called after the trump suit has been made. If the trump suit was made before round two of making, then some player must have ordered up the suit of the upcard, meaning that the trump suit will be the suit of the upcard. Now, the dealer must add the upcard to their hand and discard the card of least value. The value of the cards in their hand is judged in the context of a trump suit existing---that trump suit being the same suit of the upcard. This is works great.. . I am running into a dead end when considering how to evaluate the value of the cards in the dealer's hand when the trump suit is determined in round two of making, i.e. when the made trump suit is not the suit of the upcard. Inside the scope of SimplePlayer::add_and_discard(), only the upcard is passed in. Where previously we could assume that the suit of the upcard is the trump suit and judge the value of the cards based on that, we can no longer do so, as the trump suit that has been decided and is something different, presumable the next suit of the same color.. . How, then, should I resolve this issue? I could make a global suit type object to represent the current trump suit and call Card_less() inside of add_and_discard() using the global suit in place of the trump suit. I could change the parameters of add_and_discard() to include a suit object and pass in the trump suit that is decided in the scope of make_trump(), but I don't want to run into issues with the autograder. I can't write an alternative function because there will be no precedent to override in Player.h.. . Sorry, just very confused.
